generif.text: PLAGL2 may modulate SP-C expression during lung development.
Plag1 and Plagl2 are novel leukemia oncogenes that act by expanding hematopoietic progenitors expressing CbF beta-SMMHC.

These data clearly identify PLAGL2 as a novel regulator of NCF2/p67phox gene expression as well as NADPH oxidase activity and contribute to a greater understanding of the transcriptional regulation of NCF2.
Coexpression of Tip60 and PLAGL2 completely abolishes the sumoylation of PLAGL2.
Nuclear PLAGL2 occupied and transactivated the endogenous SP-C promoter in hypoxic lung cells.These results further suggest that PLAGL2 is an oxidative stress responding regulator in lung cells.
This study thus uncovers a novel function of PLAGL2 as an oncoprotein through regulating the stability of Pirh2.
These data suggests that Ubc9 can function as a co-factor of PLAGL2, uncoupling from its enzymatic activity, to mediate PLAGL2 interactive SP-C promoter activity.

Increased cell injury and/or death could be caused directly by the upregulation of bNip3, a preapoptotic molecule that dimerizes with Bcl-2, or indirectly by the aberrant expression of SP-C-induced endoplasmic reticulum stress in epithelial cells.
The data identify PC2 as a novel PLAGL2-binding protein and important mediator of PLAGL2 transactivation.
Clinical trial of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
Transcriptome analysis revealed that these differentiation-suppressive activities are attributable in part to PLAGL2 modulation of Wnt/beta-catenin signaling
PLAGL2 regulate cell cycle and apoptosis via activation of the p53 family member, p73, in human promonocytic U937 cells.
PLAGL2 expression induces lamellipodia formation and disruption of stress fiber formation.
Our findings indicate that PALGL2 serves as a tumor oncoprotein in the development and progression of colorectal cancer
increased expression correlates to prostate cancer progression following radical prostatectomy and may serve as novel poor prognostic marker
Our findings indicated that PLAGL2 might be a very upstream key molecule regulating Epithelial-mesenchymal transition involved in Wnt/bcatenin signaling pathway in Colorectal adenocarcinoma
overexpression of miR-449a inhibited the expression of PLAGL2 significantly and the knockdown of PLAGL2 expression inhibited the breast cancer cell proliferation and metastasis
PLAGL2 is highly expressed in the bladder urothelial carcinoma tissue and metastatic lymph node relative to the normal bladder tissue.
PLAGL2 expression is strongly associated with an IESC signature in colorectal cancer and may be responsible for contributing to the aberrant activation of an immature phenotype.
DJ-1 can promote CRC metastasis by activating PLAGL2-Wnt-BMP4 axis.

Study results indicated that PLAGL2 was overexpressed in colorectal cancer (CRC) as a protooncogene and that it could active the Wnt/betacatenin pathway as a transcription factor by binding with the promoter region of Wnt6.
Increased miR-214 expression suppresses cell migration and proliferation in Hirschsprung disease by interacting with PLAGL2.
Our team identified for the first time a bidirectional promoter pair oncogene, PLAGL2-POFUT1, in colorectal cancer (CRC).

PLAGL2 and POFUT1 were common and upregulated in tumor samples in colorectal cancer (CRC). Survival analysis of PLAGL2 and POFUT1 expression revealed differences between proximal and distal CRC. PLAGL2 and POFUT1, which have the highest correlation with tumor location, may serve as biomarkers and therapeutic targets for the precise diagnosis and treatment of CRC in the future.
PLAGL2 promotes epithelial-mesenchymal transition and mediates colorectal cancer metastasis via beta-catenin-dependent regulation of ZEB1.
The PLAGL2/MYCN/miR-506-3p interplay regulates neuroblastoma cell fate and associates with neuroblastoma progression.
Hsa-circRNA-103809 Promotes Hepatocellular Carcinoma Development via MicroRNA-1270/PLAG1 Like Zinc Finger 2 Axis.
PLAGL2 promotes the proliferation and migration of gastric cancer cells via USP37-mediated deubiquitination of Snail1.
MiR-22-3p Suppresses Cell Migration and Invasion by Targeting PLAGL2 in Breast Cancer.
LncRNA HCP5 acts as a miR-128-3p sponge to promote the progression of multiple myeloma through activating Wnt/beta-catenin/cyclin D1 signaling via PLAGL2.
Selenium sulfide disrupts the PLAGL2/C-MET/STAT3-induced resistance against mitochondrial apoptosis in hepatocellular carcinoma.
PLAGL2 Promotes the Proliferation and Migration of Diffuse Large B-cell Lymphoma Cells via Wnt/beta-catenin Pathway.
PLAGL2 increases adriamycin resistance and EMT in breast cancer cells by activating the Wnt pathway.
Amplification of the PLAG-family genes-PLAGL1 and PLAGL2-is a key feature of the novel tumor type CNS embryonal tumor with PLAGL amplification.
PLAGL2 promotes the stemness and is upregulated by transcription factor E2F1 in human lung cancer.
Long non-coding RNA LGALS8-AS1 facilitates PLAGL2-mediated malignant phenotypes in gastric cancer.
PLAGL2 promotes Snail expression and gastric cancer progression via UCA1/miR-145-5p/YTHDF1 axis.
POFUT1 and PLAGL2 are characteristic markers of mucinous colorectal cancer associated with MUC2 expression.

BP.term: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
positive regulation of intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway

MF.term: DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific
DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific

name: PLAG1 like zinc finger 2
summary: Pleiomorphic adenoma gene-like 2 is a zinc-finger protein that recognizes DNA and/or RNA. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
